> Maybe mock your actions and test if the http server routes the request
> correctly to the corresponding mocked action.

Right now i have a factory method for creating the wanted action (interface)
from the headers in the http request. Ive tested the factory class and it
creates the correct action class. So this is already tested.

BTW, if I have a factory method for creating the actions, is there a way
to mock the output of that factory method? (should I extend the factory
class to always create empty actions?)

> Build the mocks in a way that they can generate all the output/result
> which the real object can produce. Test if the http server reacts correctly
> to these outputs/results.

Hmm, now I see a "problem" with my design, i dont have a middleware between
the actual HTTP request and the action. The request parsing and the action is
the same class, maybe I should refactor this when Ive the time and the need for it.

> Is it possible to refactor you server to extract the functionality
> which routes the requests, so you can test it without running the server?

Yes, every action is created by the factory method which is tested.

//Erik
